<h1 align="center">
  GeoffDGeorge.com
</h1>

This is the latest version of my personal portfolio site, built with the [Gatsby](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/) framework and hosted via [Netlify](https://www.netlify.com/).

## Gatsby Plugins Used

-   [gatsby-plugin-react-helmet](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-plugin-react-helmet) (to manage document head data)
-   [gatsby-source-filesystem](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-source-filesystem/) (to assist with the parsing of files in specific folders)
-   [gatsby-image](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-image) (to use Gatsby's lazy-loading image component)
-   [gatsby-transformer-sharp](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-transformer-sharp) (for images using Sharp)
-   [gatsby-plugin-sharp](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-plugin-sharp) (for a wrapper for Sharp images)
-   [gatsby-plugin-transition-link](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-plugin-transition-link) (for animated page-link transitions)
-   [gatsby-plugin-styled-components](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-plugin-styled-components) (to manage CSS through Styled Components)
-   [gatsby-plugin-react-svg](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-plugin-react-svg) (to manage use of SVGs)
-   [gatsby-plugin-netlify](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-plugin-netlify) (to generate a \_headers file for Netlify)
-   [gatsby-transformer-remark](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-transformer-remark) (to parse and sort markdown files via GraphQL)
-   [gatsby-remark-images](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-remark-images) (to work with banner images in markdown blog posts)
-   [gatsby-remark-prismjs](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-remark-prismjs) (to style up code blocks in markdown blog posts)

## Issues

-   Captions needed for non-banner images in blog posts
-   Blog posts need tags
-   Each tag should link to dynamically created archive pages featuring all posts that contain the given tag
-   The main blog archive page still needs to be paginated (with five posts per page)
-   Roles should be specified for all landmark elements, for better accessibility
-   Aria-labels should be added where necessary
